content:
I'm having trouble with the ui elements on firefox, the min/max/close buttons are showing some random characters and the menu also shows an "Á" besides some options.

Still, the font on tabs and some menus looks strange, and the problem with buttons and menus keeps happening.

I don't really know what else to do

title: Firefox crasht regelmatig
content:
Mijn laptop loopt regelmatig vast tijdens gebruik van firefox.

Betreft volgende configuratie: Software: Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS Kernel versie Linux: 6.14.0-37-generic Processor: AMD A8-6410 APU with AMD Radeon R5 Graphics x 4 Memory: 4Gb Type: 64-bit Grafisch: KABINI GNOME versie: 46 Venstersysteem: Wayland

Laatste meldingen uit journal tijdens crash. firefox_firefox.desktop[19213]: [GFX1-]: Couldn't sanitize GL_RENDERER "KABINI (radeonsi, , ACO, DRM 2.50, 6.14.0-37-generic)" firefox_firefox.desktop[12111]: libva info: VA-API version 1.20.0 firefox_firefox.desktop[12111]: libva info: Trying to open /snap/firefox/7672/gnome-platform/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri/r600_drv_video.so jfirefox_firefox.desktop[12111]: libva info: Found init function __vaDriverInit_1_14 firefox_firefox.desktop[12111]: libva info: va_openDriver() returns 0

Wat kan de oorzaak zijn en hoe kan ik deze vastlopers voorkomen ?

title: Why do many websites not open in Firefox but work fine in other browsers?
content: I’m having an issue where many websites do not open properly in Firefox, but the same sites work without any problems in other browsers like Chrome or Edge. In Firefox, the pages either don’t load at all or get stuck while loading, without showing a clear error message. My internet connection seems fine, and I haven’t made any major changes recently. I’m wondering if this could be related to Firefox settings, extensions, cached data, DNS configuration, or recent browser updates. Has anyone experienced this before, and what troubleshooting steps helped resolve the issue? You can also check this as a reference https://dunkinmenu.org

title: Google account access/verification or MacOS Passkey causes Firefox to freeze
content:
I've seen similar reports of this in the past. But I believe my case is different.

I had to reset a password tonight, requiring me to re-login to the account in Firefox. But, the tab/window would just freeze. I don't see anything immediately being blocked (ie: any DNS filter etc).

But, I CAN get it to work in Debugging mode, which suggests either there is an extension that is blocking it, or something else (some variable that is otherwise active in regular running Firefox). I just don't know which.

Has anyone else reported this and what might be the issue? I suspect uBlockOrigin (one), which I do use. But the other extensions I use are just for Youtube, IG, etc.

Thanks!
